title: Everyday English Course 117
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:
M: Are you going on holiday with your sister again this year?
W: Yes, she comes home from Canada tomorrow, and then we're going away next week.
M: Where are you going?
W: I've booked a hotel in Turkey. My sister wants to go to Italy again, so I hope she doesn't mind.
{a}

variables.a: Where is the woman going for holiday this year?
Why doesn't John like his Chinese teacher?

answerOptions: The doctor won't see her tomorrow.
The doctor is busy all day today.
instances.correctAnswer: The doctor is busy all day today.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
What is the woman going to buy downtown?

questionTemplates.text:
M: What do you think of your new roommate?
W: Well, she's a bit untidy. Apart from that, she's really sweet.
M: You should have some patience then.
{a}

variables.a: What's the woman's roommate like?

answerOptions: He will talk with the woman tomorrow.
He will talk with Mr. Chen tomorrow.
instances.correctAnswer: He will talk with Mr. Chen tomorrow.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Is it true that you don't do gymnastics at all now?
W: I'm afraid so. I'm too old.
M: But you are only twenty-two!
W: That's too old for a gymnast. If I played in an international championship now, I couldn't win. So I'd rather not do it at all.
{a}

answerOptions: Because she doesn't like gymnastics now.
Because she couldn't win any international championship now.
instances.correctAnswer: Because she couldn't win any international championship now.

variables.a: Why does the woman give up doing gymnastics?

answerOptions: Mark is not fit to take charge of the Student Union.
Mark is the best candidate for the post of chairman.
It won't be easy for Mark to win the election.
instances.correctAnswer: It won't be easy for Mark to win the election.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: It is new on the menu.

variables.a: What does the man say about the dish?
What is the party like?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: Joe feels it a shame to rely on his parents.
Joe graduated from college this year.
Joe's life relies on his parents.
instances.correctAnswer: Joe's life relies on his parents.

questionTemplates.text:
W: Sally, why do people now do business more and more?
M: Right, I have to be on the flight every week.
W: Wow, I really envy you.
M: Don't envy me. In fact, I'm sick of restaurant food. Sometimes I just want a home-cook meal.
{a}

answerOptions: He has no time to cook.
He has to treat his friends.
instances.correctAnswer: He has no time to cook.

variables.a: Why does the man eat out so often?
What happened to the driver?
When does the film end?

questionTemplates.text:
M: What kind of music do you like?
W: I like classical music. Do you?
M: Well, you see, classical music always sends me to sleep.
{a}

answerOptions: He does not like it at all.
He prefers it to other music.
instances.correctAnswer: He does not like it at all.

variables.a: What does the man think of classical music?

answerOptions: She can't make up her mind.

variables.a: How does the woman like the concert?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Joan can't decide which car to buy.
W: Shouldn't she test driving a few of them first before making a final decision?
M: Well, you'd better tell her yourself.
{a}

answerOptions: Joan should test driving a few cars before making a decision.
Joan should make a decision before testing driving.
Joan should buy the car that she drives first.
instances.correctAnswer: Joan should test driving a few cars before making a decision.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

He is eager to see what the new system is like.

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:
W: How do I look?
M: Not bad. Does it fit all right?
W: Uh, a bit tight around here.
M: I really like the color. It matches your handbag.
{a}

answerOptions: Trying on a piece of clothing.
Drawing a picture of the countryside.
instances.correctAnswer: Trying on a piece of clothing.

variables.a: What is the woman doing?

answerOptions: It didn't take her long to finish it.
instances.correctAnswer: It didn't take her long to finish it.

variables.a: What does Mary say about the homework?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Can I help you?
M: Yes, I've got an appointment with Mr. James Larry. He said I should meet him in his office.
W: That's on the fourth floor. You take the lift to the fourth floor and walk down the corridor to the end. Turn left and you'll find a conference room. Mr. Larry's office is next to it.
M: Thanks very much.
{a}

answerOptions: The way to the fifth floor.
The way to Mr. Larry's office.
The way to the conference room.
instances.correctAnswer: The way to Mr. Larry's office.

variables.a: What does the man want to know?

questionTemplates.text:
M: What do you think of the film, Ellen?
W: Well, the plot is not so good.
M: But the music...
W: The music is just so-so. Anyway, the dialogue is humorous.
{a}

variables.a: Which aspect of the film does the woman like?

answerOptions: She went over it chapter by chapter.

variables.a: How did the woman read the book?

questionTemplates.text:
W: So what do you usually do in your free time?
M: At the moment, I'm spending most of my free time learning German. I also enjoy playing the violin. How about you?
W: I go to the sports club and do some exercise once a week.
{a}

variables.a: What does the man mainly do in his spare time?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Excuse me. I'd like to make a complaint.
M: Really? What seems to be the problem?
W: Well, don't you think you are playing the music too loudly?
M: Oh? I'm sorry. I didn't realize it was so loud.
W: Yes. I am preparing for my exam next week and your music is bothering me a great deal that I can't hear myself think.
M: Sorry. I'll turn it down.
{a}

answerOptions: The man is giving a party.
The woman is staying at home.
The man is going to lower the music volume.
instances.correctAnswer: The man is going to lower the music volume.

variables.a: What do we learn from this conversation?
What does the man want the woman to do?
